article.headline: Rutgers 73, Charlotte 71
article.story: CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) -- Ricky Shields and Ricky Douby each scored 20 points to lead Rutgers to a 73-71 come-from-behind victory against Charlotte on Monday night. The Scarlet Knights trailed by as many as 15 point in the first half, but rallied in the second as Douby and Shields combined for 26 points. Rutgers (1-0) also got some help from the 49ers, who connected on just 7-of-21 free-throw attempts in the second half. Charlotte (1-1) had three players in double figures, led by Eddie Basden's 19 points, including 11 in the first half. Curtis Withers, who missed the 49ers season-opener against Long Beach State for an unspecified violation of team rules, returned to score 14 points. Charlotte dominated the first half, twice building 15-point leads, once behind three consecutive 3-pointers by Basden. Rutgers had an 8-2 run over the final six minutes of the first half to cut the halftime lead to 41-30. The Scarlet Knights opened the second half with a 16-4 to take a 46-45 lead. The teams exchanged the lead 12 times over the last 11 minutes. Rutgers took a four-point lead -- its biggest advantage of the game -- after a goaltending call on the 49ers Martin Iti with 22 seconds remaining.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
